component.name: Goverlay
component.summary: Easily configure MangoHud, vkBasalt and OptiScaler

description.p: Goverlay is an easy graphical interface to configure MangoHud, vkBasalt, and OptiScaler. Goverlay helps Linux gamers get the most out of their systems by providing an easy-to-use graphical interface to configure MangoHud, vkBasalt, and OptiScaler. Whether you're looking for performance monitoring, visual enhancements, or smarter upscaling, Goverlay makes everything accessible in just a few clicks.

screenshot.caption: Performance section to configure fps,frame time..
Metrics section to configure CPU and GPU stats.
Extra goodies like distro info, wine version..

ul.li: Fixed: MangoHud and vkBasalt config files now correctly saved to ~/.config/ instead of Flatpak sandbox
Fixed: Desktop notifications now work in Flatpak mode
Improved: Flatpak dependency detection via .so files instead of runtime checks
Added: "None" option for log toggle key to disable logging hotkey
Changed: Log folder path uses Flatpak-specific location when running in Flatpak
Added: "Use both GPUs" option for multi-GPU systems
Improved: GPU detection and gpu_list configuration
Fixed: Flatpak runtime detection for MangoHud and vkBasalt
Fixed: PasCube/vkCube fallback logic with Wayland support
Fixed: fgmod path for Flatpak persist directory
Fixed: Spelling errors in UI
Improved: System detection and configuration paths
Prioritized: PasCube execution on startup
OptiScaler channel selection (stable or bleeding-edge versions)
Sync versions with OptiScaler (now we don't use decky-framegen builds anymore)
OptiScaler builds repo workflow for OptiScaler builds by @xXJSONDeruloXx
GNOME fixes: tab text visibility on GNOME with dark themes
Debug logging: 50+ debug checkpoints throughout OptiScaler operations
Flatpak support: MangoHud configuration for Flatpak Steam
